paper_abstract: We present several new results on the impartial two-person game Kayles. The original version is played on a row of pins ("kayles"). We investigate variants of the game played on graphs. We solve a previously stated open problem in proving that determining the value of a game position needs only polynomial time in a star of bounded degree, and therefore finding the winning move - if one exists - can be done in linear time based on the data calculated before.
paper_title: Kayles on the way to the stars
